section.p: 1. This sentence mentions the most common types of injury.
2. This sentence is about where on the body most injuries occur.
3. This sentence is about the most common places for injuries to occur.
4. This section of the report compares men and women.
5. This sentence compares men and women in terms of the location they had their injuries.
The tables show the most common types of injury in Canada during a single year, where they happened, and the proportion of men and women who sustained these injuries.

p.font: (1), sprains and strains were by far the most common, followed by fractures to bones. (2), it is clear that, overall, the legs and feet were the most common locations for injuries. (3), it is perhaps not surprising that the home and sports facilities were the most common settings.

(4), there seems to be no consistent pattern which associates types of injury with men or women. However, (5), it is noticeable that for men the most common places were sports facilities while for women it was the home.

section.p: In your report you will have to describe a number of different trends or patterns that are shown in the table or chart. It is important that you let the reader know when you have finished dealing with one aspect of the figures and are about to deal with another aspect. There are certain 'signpost' expressions, which good writers use in order to achieve this, for example, 'concerning' or 'regarding'. When you use these expressions, make sure you follow them with appropriate sentence structure.
